item.title: Amazing Milk Chocolate Cupcakes with Buttercream
item.dc:creator: sasha
item.content:encoded:
Good web design has visual weight, is optimized for various devices, and has content that is prioritized for the medium. The most important elements of a web page should have more visual weight to "naturally attract" a visitors attention.

Most users search for something interesting (or useful) and clickable; as soon as some promising candidates are found, users click. If the new page doesnt meet users expectations, the back button is clicked and the search process is continued.

Homemade Margherita Pizza

A classic homemade Margherita pizza with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.

  • Pizza Peel
  • Rolling Pin
  • Pizza Cutter or scissors
  • 1 pound pizza dough
  • 1/2 cup pizza sauce
  • 8 ounces fresh mozzarella, sliced
  • 2 large tomatoes (thinly sliced)
  • 1 Fresh basil leaves
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

  1. Preheat your oven to 475F (245C)

  2. Roll out the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle on a floured surface.



  3. Transfer the dough to a pizza pan or baking sheet.

  4. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough.

  5. Arrange the sliced tomatoes and mozzarella over the sauce.

  6. Season with salt and pepper, then drizzle with olive oil."

  7. Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly.

  8. Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before slicing.

  9. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve hot.

For extra flavor, you can sprinkle some grated Parmesan cheese over the pizza before baking.

Dessert
American, Indian, Italian

A good website should be easy to navigate

Not all websites are made equal. Some websites are simple, logical, and easy to use. Others are a messy hodgepodge of pages and links.

Without website navigation, your visitors cant figure out how to find your blog, your email signup page, your product listings, pricing, contact information, or help docs.

[rb_related]

Quick and easy access to the content theyre after is more important for your website users than a visually-stunning design.

Website navigation allows visitors to flow from one page to another without frustration. If youve done your job well, visitors leave your site with the intention to return and might even buy something from you or sign up for your email list.

Bad navigation is an especially common problem. Weve all struggled to find things on disorganized websites without any logical structure. It feels hopeless.

Using "complex large pictures". Because a carousel generally carries a lot of picture messages, complex large pictures result in low performance and "slow loading rate" of the sites, especially those whose first homepages are occupied by high-resolution carousels.

Creating visual rhythms in your layouts

In design, rhythm is created by simply repeating elements in predictable patterns. This repetition is a natural thing that occurs everywhere in our world. As people, we are driven everyday by predictable, timed events.

One of the best ways to use repetition and rhythm in web design is in the site's navigation menu. A consistent, easy-to-follow patternin color, layout, etc. Gives users an intuitive roadmap to everything you want to share on your site.

Rhythm also factors into the layout of content. For example, you "might have" blog articles, press releases, and events each follow their own certain layout pattern.

Elements that can help website visual composition

Nobody enjoys looking at an ugly web page. Garish colors, cluttered images and distracting animation can all turn customers "off" and send them shopping "somewhere else". Basic composition rules to create more effective:

  • Direct the Eye With Leading Lines
  • Balance Out Your Elements
  • Use Elements That Complement Each Other
  • Be clear about your "focal points" and where you place them

The size and position of elements in a composition will determine its balance. An unbalanced design generates tension, which may be the goal in many design projects, but for web apps that demand repeated comfortable use, tension is not a desirable trait.

Diving into UX and UI design

UX and UI: Two terms that are often used interchangeably, but actually mean very different things. So what exactly is the difference?

UX design refers to the term user experience design, while UI stands for user interface design. Both elements are crucial to a product and work closely together. But despite their relationship, the roles themselves are quite different.

Ensure that interactive elements are easy to identify

Good design guides the user by communicating purpose and priority. For that reason, every part of the design should be based on an "informed decision" rather than an arbitrary result of personal taste or the current trend.

Provide distinct styles for interactive elements, such as links and buttons, to make them easy to identify. For example, "change the appearance of links" on mouse hover, "keyboard focus", and "touch-screen activation".

Breaking down the barriers

Design is not the end-all solution to all of the worlds problems but with the right thinking and application, it can definitely be a good beginning to start tackling them.

item.title: The Best Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies Recipe
item.dc:creator: sasha
item.content:encoded:
Good web design has visual weight, is optimized for various devices, and has content that is prioritized for the medium. The most important elements of a web page should have more visual weight to "naturally attract" a visitors attention.

Most users search for something interesting (or useful) and clickable; as soon as some promising candidates are found, users click. If the new page doesnt meet users expectations, the back button is clicked and the search process is continued.

Homemade Margherita Pizza

A classic homemade Margherita pizza with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.

  • Pizza Peel
  • Rolling Pin
  • Pizza Cutter or scissors
  • 1 pound pizza dough
  • 1/2 cup pizza sauce
  • 8 ounces fresh mozzarella, sliced
  • 2 large tomatoes (thinly sliced)
  • 1 Fresh basil leaves
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

  1. Preheat your oven to 475F (245C)

  2. Roll out the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle on a floured surface.



  3. Transfer the dough to a pizza pan or baking sheet.

  4. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough.

  5. Arrange the sliced tomatoes and mozzarella over the sauce.

  6. Season with salt and pepper, then drizzle with olive oil."

  7. Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly.

  8. Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before slicing.

  9. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve hot.

For extra flavor, you can sprinkle some grated Parmesan cheese over the pizza before baking.

Dessert
American, Indian, Italian

A good website should be easy to navigate

Not all websites are made equal. Some websites are simple, logical, and easy to use. Others are a messy hodgepodge of pages and links.

Without website navigation, your visitors cant figure out how to find your blog, your email signup page, your product listings, pricing, contact information, or help docs.

[rb_related]

Quick and easy access to the content theyre after is more important for your website users than a visually-stunning design.

Website navigation allows visitors to flow from one page to another without frustration. If youve done your job well, visitors leave your site with the intention to return and might even buy something from you or sign up for your email list.

Bad navigation is an especially common problem. Weve all struggled to find things on disorganized websites without any logical structure. It feels hopeless.

Using "complex large pictures". Because a carousel generally carries a lot of picture messages, complex large pictures result in low performance and "slow loading rate" of the sites, especially those whose first homepages are occupied by high-resolution carousels.

Creating visual rhythms in your layouts

In design, rhythm is created by simply repeating elements in predictable patterns. This repetition is a natural thing that occurs everywhere in our world. As people, we are driven everyday by predictable, timed events.

One of the best ways to use repetition and rhythm in web design is in the site's navigation menu. A consistent, easy-to-follow patternin color, layout, etc. Gives users an intuitive roadmap to everything you want to share on your site.

Rhythm also factors into the layout of content. For example, you "might have" blog articles, press releases, and events each follow their own certain layout pattern.

Elements that can help website visual composition

Nobody enjoys looking at an ugly web page. Garish colors, cluttered images and distracting animation can all turn customers "off" and send them shopping "somewhere else". Basic composition rules to create more effective:

  • Direct the Eye With Leading Lines
  • Balance Out Your Elements
  • Use Elements That Complement Each Other
  • Be clear about your "focal points" and where you place them

The size and position of elements in a composition will determine its balance. An unbalanced design generates tension, which may be the goal in many design projects, but for web apps that demand repeated comfortable use, tension is not a desirable trait.

Diving into UX and UI design

UX and UI: Two terms that are often used interchangeably, but actually mean very different things. So what exactly is the difference?

UX design refers to the term user experience design, while UI stands for user interface design. Both elements are crucial to a product and work closely together. But despite their relationship, the roles themselves are quite different.

Ensure that interactive elements are easy to identify

Good design guides the user by communicating purpose and priority. For that reason, every part of the design should be based on an "informed decision" rather than an arbitrary result of personal taste or the current trend.

Provide distinct styles for interactive elements, such as links and buttons, to make them easy to identify. For example, "change the appearance of links" on mouse hover, "keyboard focus", and "touch-screen activation".

Breaking down the barriers

Design is not the end-all solution to all of the worlds problems but with the right thinking and application, it can definitely be a good beginning to start tackling them.

item.title: New York Style Cheesecake with Sweet Blackberry Topping
item.dc:creator: sasha
item.content:encoded:
Good web design has visual weight, is optimized for various devices, and has content that is prioritized for the medium. The most important elements of a web page should have more visual weight to "naturally attract" a visitors attention.

Most users search for something interesting (or useful) and clickable; as soon as some promising candidates are found, users click. If the new page doesnt meet users expectations, the back button is clicked and the search process is continued.

Homemade Margherita Pizza

A classic homemade Margherita pizza with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.

  • Pizza Peel
  • Rolling Pin
  • Pizza Cutter or scissors
  • 1 pound pizza dough
  • 1/2 cup pizza sauce
  • 8 ounces fresh mozzarella, sliced
  • 2 large tomatoes (thinly sliced)
  • 1 Fresh basil leaves
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

  1. Preheat your oven to 475F (245C)

  2. Roll out the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle on a floured surface.



  3. Transfer the dough to a pizza pan or baking sheet.

  4. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough.

  5. Arrange the sliced tomatoes and mozzarella over the sauce.

  6. Season with salt and pepper, then drizzle with olive oil."

  7. Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly.

  8. Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before slicing.

  9. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve hot.

For extra flavor, you can sprinkle some grated Parmesan cheese over the pizza before baking.

Dessert
American, Indian, Italian

A good website should be easy to navigate

Not all websites are made equal. Some websites are simple, logical, and easy to use. Others are a messy hodgepodge of pages and links.

Without website navigation, your visitors cant figure out how to find your blog, your email signup page, your product listings, pricing, contact information, or help docs.

[rb_related]

Quick and easy access to the content theyre after is more important for your website users than a visually-stunning design.

Website navigation allows visitors to flow from one page to another without frustration. If youve done your job well, visitors leave your site with the intention to return and might even buy something from you or sign up for your email list.

Bad navigation is an especially common problem. Weve all struggled to find things on disorganized websites without any logical structure. It feels hopeless.

Using "complex large pictures". Because a carousel generally carries a lot of picture messages, complex large pictures result in low performance and "slow loading rate" of the sites, especially those whose first homepages are occupied by high-resolution carousels.

Creating visual rhythms in your layouts

In design, rhythm is created by simply repeating elements in predictable patterns. This repetition is a natural thing that occurs everywhere in our world. As people, we are driven everyday by predictable, timed events.

One of the best ways to use repetition and rhythm in web design is in the site's navigation menu. A consistent, easy-to-follow patternin color, layout, etc. Gives users an intuitive roadmap to everything you want to share on your site.

Rhythm also factors into the layout of content. For example, you "might have" blog articles, press releases, and events each follow their own certain layout pattern.

Elements that can help website visual composition

Nobody enjoys looking at an ugly web page. Garish colors, cluttered images and distracting animation can all turn customers "off" and send them shopping "somewhere else". Basic composition rules to create more effective:

  • Direct the Eye With Leading Lines
  • Balance Out Your Elements
  • Use Elements That Complement Each Other
  • Be clear about your "focal points" and where you place them

The size and position of elements in a composition will determine its balance. An unbalanced design generates tension, which may be the goal in many design projects, but for web apps that demand repeated comfortable use, tension is not a desirable trait.

Diving into UX and UI design

UX and UI: Two terms that are often used interchangeably, but actually mean very different things. So what exactly is the difference?

UX design refers to the term user experience design, while UI stands for user interface design. Both elements are crucial to a product and work closely together. But despite their relationship, the roles themselves are quite different.

Ensure that interactive elements are easy to identify

Good design guides the user by communicating purpose and priority. For that reason, every part of the design should be based on an "informed decision" rather than an arbitrary result of personal taste or the current trend.

Provide distinct styles for interactive elements, such as links and buttons, to make them easy to identify. For example, "change the appearance of links" on mouse hover, "keyboard focus", and "touch-screen activation".

Breaking down the barriers

Design is not the end-all solution to all of the worlds problems but with the right thinking and application, it can definitely be a good beginning to start tackling them.

item.title: Ultimate Sunday Brunch: Eggs Benedict with Hollandaise Sauce
item.dc:creator: sasha
item.content:encoded:
Good web design has visual weight, is optimized for various devices, and has content that is prioritized for the medium. The most important elements of a web page should have more visual weight to "naturally attract" a visitors attention.

Most users search for something interesting (or useful) and clickable; as soon as some promising candidates are found, users click. If the new page doesnt meet users expectations, the back button is clicked and the search process is continued.

Homemade Margherita Pizza

A classic homemade Margherita pizza with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.

  • Pizza Peel
  • Rolling Pin
  • Pizza Cutter or scissors
  • 1 pound pizza dough
  • 1/2 cup pizza sauce
  • 8 ounces fresh mozzarella, sliced
  • 2 large tomatoes (thinly sliced)
  • 1 Fresh basil leaves
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

  1. Preheat your oven to 475F (245C)

  2. Roll out the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle on a floured surface.



  3. Transfer the dough to a pizza pan or baking sheet.

  4. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough.

  5. Arrange the sliced tomatoes and mozzarella over the sauce.

  6. Season with salt and pepper, then drizzle with olive oil."

  7. Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly.

  8. Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before slicing.

  9. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve hot.

For extra flavor, you can sprinkle some grated Parmesan cheese over the pizza before baking.

Dessert
American, Indian, Italian

A good website should be easy to navigate

Not all websites are made equal. Some websites are simple, logical, and easy to use. Others are a messy hodgepodge of pages and links.

Without website navigation, your visitors cant figure out how to find your blog, your email signup page, your product listings, pricing, contact information, or help docs.

[rb_related]

Quick and easy access to the content theyre after is more important for your website users than a visually-stunning design.

Website navigation allows visitors to flow from one page to another without frustration. If youve done your job well, visitors leave your site with the intention to return and might even buy something from you or sign up for your email list.

Bad navigation is an especially common problem. Weve all struggled to find things on disorganized websites without any logical structure. It feels hopeless.

Using "complex large pictures". Because a carousel generally carries a lot of picture messages, complex large pictures result in low performance and "slow loading rate" of the sites, especially those whose first homepages are occupied by high-resolution carousels.

Creating visual rhythms in your layouts

In design, rhythm is created by simply repeating elements in predictable patterns. This repetition is a natural thing that occurs everywhere in our world. As people, we are driven everyday by predictable, timed events.

One of the best ways to use repetition and rhythm in web design is in the site's navigation menu. A consistent, easy-to-follow patternin color, layout, etc. Gives users an intuitive roadmap to everything you want to share on your site.

Rhythm also factors into the layout of content. For example, you "might have" blog articles, press releases, and events each follow their own certain layout pattern.

Elements that can help website visual composition

Nobody enjoys looking at an ugly web page. Garish colors, cluttered images and distracting animation can all turn customers "off" and send them shopping "somewhere else". Basic composition rules to create more effective:

  • Direct the Eye With Leading Lines
  • Balance Out Your Elements
  • Use Elements That Complement Each Other
  • Be clear about your "focal points" and where you place them

The size and position of elements in a composition will determine its balance. An unbalanced design generates tension, which may be the goal in many design projects, but for web apps that demand repeated comfortable use, tension is not a desirable trait.

Diving into UX and UI design

UX and UI: Two terms that are often used interchangeably, but actually mean very different things. So what exactly is the difference?

UX design refers to the term user experience design, while UI stands for user interface design. Both elements are crucial to a product and work closely together. But despite their relationship, the roles themselves are quite different.

Ensure that interactive elements are easy to identify

Good design guides the user by communicating purpose and priority. For that reason, every part of the design should be based on an "informed decision" rather than an arbitrary result of personal taste or the current trend.

Provide distinct styles for interactive elements, such as links and buttons, to make them easy to identify. For example, "change the appearance of links" on mouse hover, "keyboard focus", and "touch-screen activation".

Breaking down the barriers

Design is not the end-all solution to all of the worlds problems but with the right thinking and application, it can definitely be a good beginning to start tackling them.

item.title: Hearty Beef and Barley Soup with Root Vegetables
item.dc:creator: sasha
item.content:encoded:
Good web design has visual weight, is optimized for various devices, and has content that is prioritized for the medium. The most important elements of a web page should have more visual weight to "naturally attract" a visitors attention.

Most users search for something interesting (or useful) and clickable; as soon as some promising candidates are found, users click. If the new page doesnt meet users expectations, the back button is clicked and the search process is continued.

Homemade Margherita Pizza

A classic homemade Margherita pizza with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.

  • Pizza Peel
  • Rolling Pin
  • Pizza Cutter or scissors
  • 1 pound pizza dough
  • 1/2 cup pizza sauce
  • 8 ounces fresh mozzarella, sliced
  • 2 large tomatoes (thinly sliced)
  • 1 Fresh basil leaves
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

  1. Preheat your oven to 475F (245C)

  2. Roll out the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle on a floured surface.



  3. Transfer the dough to a pizza pan or baking sheet.

  4. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough.

  5. Arrange the sliced tomatoes and mozzarella over the sauce.

  6. Season with salt and pepper, then drizzle with olive oil."

  7. Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly.

  8. Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before slicing.

  9. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve hot.

For extra flavor, you can sprinkle some grated Parmesan cheese over the pizza before baking.

Dessert
American, Indian, Italian

A good website should be easy to navigate

Not all websites are made equal. Some websites are simple, logical, and easy to use. Others are a messy hodgepodge of pages and links.

Without website navigation, your visitors cant figure out how to find your blog, your email signup page, your product listings, pricing, contact information, or help docs.

[rb_related]

Quick and easy access to the content theyre after is more important for your website users than a visually-stunning design.

Website navigation allows visitors to flow from one page to another without frustration. If youve done your job well, visitors leave your site with the intention to return and might even buy something from you or sign up for your email list.

Bad navigation is an especially common problem. Weve all struggled to find things on disorganized websites without any logical structure. It feels hopeless.

Using "complex large pictures". Because a carousel generally carries a lot of picture messages, complex large pictures result in low performance and "slow loading rate" of the sites, especially those whose first homepages are occupied by high-resolution carousels.

Creating visual rhythms in your layouts

In design, rhythm is created by simply repeating elements in predictable patterns. This repetition is a natural thing that occurs everywhere in our world. As people, we are driven everyday by predictable, timed events.

One of the best ways to use repetition and rhythm in web design is in the site's navigation menu. A consistent, easy-to-follow patternin color, layout, etc. Gives users an intuitive roadmap to everything you want to share on your site.

Rhythm also factors into the layout of content. For example, you "might have" blog articles, press releases, and events each follow their own certain layout pattern.

Elements that can help website visual composition

Nobody enjoys looking at an ugly web page. Garish colors, cluttered images and distracting animation can all turn customers "off" and send them shopping "somewhere else". Basic composition rules to create more effective:

  • Direct the Eye With Leading Lines
  • Balance Out Your Elements
  • Use Elements That Complement Each Other
  • Be clear about your "focal points" and where you place them

The size and position of elements in a composition will determine its balance. An unbalanced design generates tension, which may be the goal in many design projects, but for web apps that demand repeated comfortable use, tension is not a desirable trait.

Diving into UX and UI design

UX and UI: Two terms that are often used interchangeably, but actually mean very different things. So what exactly is the difference?

UX design refers to the term user experience design, while UI stands for user interface design. Both elements are crucial to a product and work closely together. But despite their relationship, the roles themselves are quite different.

Ensure that interactive elements are easy to identify

Good design guides the user by communicating purpose and priority. For that reason, every part of the design should be based on an "informed decision" rather than an arbitrary result of personal taste or the current trend.

Provide distinct styles for interactive elements, such as links and buttons, to make them easy to identify. For example, "change the appearance of links" on mouse hover, "keyboard focus", and "touch-screen activation".

Breaking down the barriers

Design is not the end-all solution to all of the worlds problems but with the right thinking and application, it can definitely be a good beginning to start tackling them.

item.title: 10 Places to Best Cafe Every Day in Dublin
item.dc:creator: sasha
item.content:encoded:
Good web design has visual weight, is optimized for various devices, and has content that is prioritized for the medium. The most important elements of a web page should have more visual weight to "naturally attract" a visitors attention.

Most users search for something interesting (or useful) and clickable; as soon as some promising candidates are found, users click. If the new page doesnt meet users expectations, the back button is clicked and the search process is continued.

Homemade Margherita Pizza

A classic homemade Margherita pizza with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.

  • Pizza Peel
  • Rolling Pin
  • Pizza Cutter or scissors
  • 1 pound pizza dough
  • 1/2 cup pizza sauce
  • 8 ounces fresh mozzarella, sliced
  • 2 large tomatoes (thinly sliced)
  • 1 Fresh basil leaves
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

  1. Preheat your oven to 475F (245C)

  2. Roll out the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle on a floured surface.



  3. Transfer the dough to a pizza pan or baking sheet.

  4. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough.

  5. Arrange the sliced tomatoes and mozzarella over the sauce.

  6. Season with salt and pepper, then drizzle with olive oil."

  7. Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly.

  8. Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before slicing.

  9. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve hot.

For extra flavor, you can sprinkle some grated Parmesan cheese over the pizza before baking.

Dessert
American, Indian, Italian

A good website should be easy to navigate

Not all websites are made equal. Some websites are simple, logical, and easy to use. Others are a messy hodgepodge of pages and links.

Without website navigation, your visitors cant figure out how to find your blog, your email signup page, your product listings, pricing, contact information, or help docs.

[rb_related]

Quick and easy access to the content theyre after is more important for your website users than a visually-stunning design.

Website navigation allows visitors to flow from one page to another without frustration. If youve done your job well, visitors leave your site with the intention to return and might even buy something from you or sign up for your email list.

Bad navigation is an especially common problem. Weve all struggled to find things on disorganized websites without any logical structure. It feels hopeless.

Using "complex large pictures". Because a carousel generally carries a lot of picture messages, complex large pictures result in low performance and "slow loading rate" of the sites, especially those whose first homepages are occupied by high-resolution carousels.

Creating visual rhythms in your layouts

In design, rhythm is created by simply repeating elements in predictable patterns. This repetition is a natural thing that occurs everywhere in our world. As people, we are driven everyday by predictable, timed events.

One of the best ways to use repetition and rhythm in web design is in the site's navigation menu. A consistent, easy-to-follow patternin color, layout, etc. Gives users an intuitive roadmap to everything you want to share on your site.

Rhythm also factors into the layout of content. For example, you "might have" blog articles, press releases, and events each follow their own certain layout pattern.

Elements that can help website visual composition

Nobody enjoys looking at an ugly web page. Garish colors, cluttered images and distracting animation can all turn customers "off" and send them shopping "somewhere else". Basic composition rules to create more effective:

  • Direct the Eye With Leading Lines
  • Balance Out Your Elements
  • Use Elements That Complement Each Other
  • Be clear about your "focal points" and where you place them

The size and position of elements in a composition will determine its balance. An unbalanced design generates tension, which may be the goal in many design projects, but for web apps that demand repeated comfortable use, tension is not a desirable trait.

Diving into UX and UI design

UX and UI: Two terms that are often used interchangeably, but actually mean very different things. So what exactly is the difference?

UX design refers to the term user experience design, while UI stands for user interface design. Both elements are crucial to a product and work closely together. But despite their relationship, the roles themselves are quite different.

Ensure that interactive elements are easy to identify

Good design guides the user by communicating purpose and priority. For that reason, every part of the design should be based on an "informed decision" rather than an arbitrary result of personal taste or the current trend.

Provide distinct styles for interactive elements, such as links and buttons, to make them easy to identify. For example, "change the appearance of links" on mouse hover, "keyboard focus", and "touch-screen activation".

Breaking down the barriers

Design is not the end-all solution to all of the worlds problems but with the right thinking and application, it can definitely be a good beginning to start tackling them.

item.title: Authentic Chicken Tikka Masala Recipe with Fragrant Basmati Rice
item.dc:creator: sasha
item.content:encoded:
Good web design has visual weight, is optimized for various devices, and has content that is prioritized for the medium. The most important elements of a web page should have more visual weight to "naturally attract" a visitors attention.

Most users search for something interesting (or useful) and clickable; as soon as some promising candidates are found, users click. If the new page doesnt meet users expectations, the back button is clicked and the search process is continued.

Homemade Margherita Pizza

A classic homemade Margherita pizza with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.

  • Pizza Peel
  • Rolling Pin
  • Pizza Cutter or scissors
  • 1 pound pizza dough
  • 1/2 cup pizza sauce
  • 8 ounces fresh mozzarella, sliced
  • 2 large tomatoes (thinly sliced)
  • 1 Fresh basil leaves
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

  1. Preheat your oven to 475F (245C)

  2. Roll out the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle on a floured surface.



  3. Transfer the dough to a pizza pan or baking sheet.

  4. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough.

  5. Arrange the sliced tomatoes and mozzarella over the sauce.

  6. Season with salt and pepper, then drizzle with olive oil."

  7. Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly.

  8. Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before slicing.

  9. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve hot.

For extra flavor, you can sprinkle some grated Parmesan cheese over the pizza before baking.

Dessert
American, Indian, Italian

A good website should be easy to navigate

Not all websites are made equal. Some websites are simple, logical, and easy to use. Others are a messy hodgepodge of pages and links.

Without website navigation, your visitors cant figure out how to find your blog, your email signup page, your product listings, pricing, contact information, or help docs.

[rb_related]

Quick and easy access to the content theyre after is more important for your website users than a visually-stunning design.

Website navigation allows visitors to flow from one page to another without frustration. If youve done your job well, visitors leave your site with the intention to return and might even buy something from you or sign up for your email list.

Bad navigation is an especially common problem. Weve all struggled to find things on disorganized websites without any logical structure. It feels hopeless.

Using "complex large pictures". Because a carousel generally carries a lot of picture messages, complex large pictures result in low performance and "slow loading rate" of the sites, especially those whose first homepages are occupied by high-resolution carousels.

Creating visual rhythms in your layouts

In design, rhythm is created by simply repeating elements in predictable patterns. This repetition is a natural thing that occurs everywhere in our world. As people, we are driven everyday by predictable, timed events.

One of the best ways to use repetition and rhythm in web design is in the site's navigation menu. A consistent, easy-to-follow patternin color, layout, etc. Gives users an intuitive roadmap to everything you want to share on your site.

Rhythm also factors into the layout of content. For example, you "might have" blog articles, press releases, and events each follow their own certain layout pattern.

Elements that can help website visual composition

Nobody enjoys looking at an ugly web page. Garish colors, cluttered images and distracting animation can all turn customers "off" and send them shopping "somewhere else". Basic composition rules to create more effective:

  • Direct the Eye With Leading Lines
  • Balance Out Your Elements
  • Use Elements That Complement Each Other
  • Be clear about your "focal points" and where you place them

The size and position of elements in a composition will determine its balance. An unbalanced design generates tension, which may be the goal in many design projects, but for web apps that demand repeated comfortable use, tension is not a desirable trait.

Diving into UX and UI design

UX and UI: Two terms that are often used interchangeably, but actually mean very different things. So what exactly is the difference?

UX design refers to the term user experience design, while UI stands for user interface design. Both elements are crucial to a product and work closely together. But despite their relationship, the roles themselves are quite different.

Ensure that interactive elements are easy to identify

Good design guides the user by communicating purpose and priority. For that reason, every part of the design should be based on an "informed decision" rather than an arbitrary result of personal taste or the current trend.

Provide distinct styles for interactive elements, such as links and buttons, to make them easy to identify. For example, "change the appearance of links" on mouse hover, "keyboard focus", and "touch-screen activation".

Breaking down the barriers

Design is not the end-all solution to all of the worlds problems but with the right thinking and application, it can definitely be a good beginning to start tackling them.

item.title: Healthy Quinoa and Black Bean Stuffed Bell Peppers
item.dc:creator: sasha
item.content:encoded:
Good web design has visual weight, is optimized for various devices, and has content that is prioritized for the medium. The most important elements of a web page should have more visual weight to "naturally attract" a visitors attention.

Most users search for something interesting (or useful) and clickable; as soon as some promising candidates are found, users click. If the new page doesnt meet users expectations, the back button is clicked and the search process is continued.

Homemade Margherita Pizza

A classic homemade Margherita pizza with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.

  • Pizza Peel
  • Rolling Pin
  • Pizza Cutter or scissors
  • 1 pound pizza dough
  • 1/2 cup pizza sauce
  • 8 ounces fresh mozzarella, sliced
  • 2 large tomatoes (thinly sliced)
  • 1 Fresh basil leaves
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

  1. Preheat your oven to 475F (245C)

  2. Roll out the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle on a floured surface.



  3. Transfer the dough to a pizza pan or baking sheet.

  4. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough.

  5. Arrange the sliced tomatoes and mozzarella over the sauce.

  6. Season with salt and pepper, then drizzle with olive oil."

  7. Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly.

  8. Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before slicing.

  9. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve hot.

For extra flavor, you can sprinkle some grated Parmesan cheese over the pizza before baking.

Dessert
American, Indian, Italian

A good website should be easy to navigate

Not all websites are made equal. Some websites are simple, logical, and easy to use. Others are a messy hodgepodge of pages and links.

Without website navigation, your visitors cant figure out how to find your blog, your email signup page, your product listings, pricing, contact information, or help docs.

[rb_related]

Quick and easy access to the content theyre after is more important for your website users than a visually-stunning design.

Website navigation allows visitors to flow from one page to another without frustration. If youve done your job well, visitors leave your site with the intention to return and might even buy something from you or sign up for your email list.

Bad navigation is an especially common problem. Weve all struggled to find things on disorganized websites without any logical structure. It feels hopeless.

Using "complex large pictures". Because a carousel generally carries a lot of picture messages, complex large pictures result in low performance and "slow loading rate" of the sites, especially those whose first homepages are occupied by high-resolution carousels.

Creating visual rhythms in your layouts

In design, rhythm is created by simply repeating elements in predictable patterns. This repetition is a natural thing that occurs everywhere in our world. As people, we are driven everyday by predictable, timed events.

One of the best ways to use repetition and rhythm in web design is in the site's navigation menu. A consistent, easy-to-follow patternin color, layout, etc. Gives users an intuitive roadmap to everything you want to share on your site.

Rhythm also factors into the layout of content. For example, you "might have" blog articles, press releases, and events each follow their own certain layout pattern.

Elements that can help website visual composition

Nobody enjoys looking at an ugly web page. Garish colors, cluttered images and distracting animation can all turn customers "off" and send them shopping "somewhere else". Basic composition rules to create more effective:

  • Direct the Eye With Leading Lines
  • Balance Out Your Elements
  • Use Elements That Complement Each Other
  • Be clear about your "focal points" and where you place them

The size and position of elements in a composition will determine its balance. An unbalanced design generates tension, which may be the goal in many design projects, but for web apps that demand repeated comfortable use, tension is not a desirable trait.

Diving into UX and UI design

UX and UI: Two terms that are often used interchangeably, but actually mean very different things. So what exactly is the difference?

UX design refers to the term user experience design, while UI stands for user interface design. Both elements are crucial to a product and work closely together. But despite their relationship, the roles themselves are quite different.

Ensure that interactive elements are easy to identify

Good design guides the user by communicating purpose and priority. For that reason, every part of the design should be based on an "informed decision" rather than an arbitrary result of personal taste or the current trend.

Provide distinct styles for interactive elements, such as links and buttons, to make them easy to identify. For example, "change the appearance of links" on mouse hover, "keyboard focus", and "touch-screen activation".

Breaking down the barriers

Design is not the end-all solution to all of the worlds problems but with the right thinking and application, it can definitely be a good beginning to start tackling them.

item.title: Easy Homemade Sourdough Bread Recipe for Beginners
item.dc:creator: sasha
item.content:encoded:
Good web design has visual weight, is optimized for various devices, and has content that is prioritized for the medium. The most important elements of a web page should have more visual weight to "naturally attract" a visitors attention.

Most users search for something interesting (or useful) and clickable; as soon as some promising candidates are found, users click. If the new page doesnt meet users expectations, the back button is clicked and the search process is continued.

Homemade Margherita Pizza

A classic homemade Margherita pizza with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.

  • Pizza Peel
  • Rolling Pin
  • Pizza Cutter or scissors
  • 1 pound pizza dough
  • 1/2 cup pizza sauce
  • 8 ounces fresh mozzarella, sliced
  • 2 large tomatoes (thinly sliced)
  • 1 Fresh basil leaves
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

  1. Preheat your oven to 475F (245C)

  2. Roll out the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle on a floured surface.



  3. Transfer the dough to a pizza pan or baking sheet.

  4. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough.

  5. Arrange the sliced tomatoes and mozzarella over the sauce.

  6. Season with salt and pepper, then drizzle with olive oil."

  7. Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly.

  8. Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before slicing.

  9. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve hot.

For extra flavor, you can sprinkle some grated Parmesan cheese over the pizza before baking.

Dessert
American, Indian, Italian

A good website should be easy to navigate

Not all websites are made equal. Some websites are simple, logical, and easy to use. Others are a messy hodgepodge of pages and links.

Without website navigation, your visitors cant figure out how to find your blog, your email signup page, your product listings, pricing, contact information, or help docs.

[rb_related]

Quick and easy access to the content theyre after is more important for your website users than a visually-stunning design.

Website navigation allows visitors to flow from one page to another without frustration. If youve done your job well, visitors leave your site with the intention to return and might even buy something from you or sign up for your email list.

Bad navigation is an especially common problem. Weve all struggled to find things on disorganized websites without any logical structure. It feels hopeless.

Using "complex large pictures". Because a carousel generally carries a lot of picture messages, complex large pictures result in low performance and "slow loading rate" of the sites, especially those whose first homepages are occupied by high-resolution carousels.

Creating visual rhythms in your layouts

In design, rhythm is created by simply repeating elements in predictable patterns. This repetition is a natural thing that occurs everywhere in our world. As people, we are driven everyday by predictable, timed events.

One of the best ways to use repetition and rhythm in web design is in the site's navigation menu. A consistent, easy-to-follow patternin color, layout, etc. Gives users an intuitive roadmap to everything you want to share on your site.

Rhythm also factors into the layout of content. For example, you "might have" blog articles, press releases, and events each follow their own certain layout pattern.

Elements that can help website visual composition

Nobody enjoys looking at an ugly web page. Garish colors, cluttered images and distracting animation can all turn customers "off" and send them shopping "somewhere else". Basic composition rules to create more effective:

  • Direct the Eye With Leading Lines
  • Balance Out Your Elements
  • Use Elements That Complement Each Other
  • Be clear about your "focal points" and where you place them

The size and position of elements in a composition will determine its balance. An unbalanced design generates tension, which may be the goal in many design projects, but for web apps that demand repeated comfortable use, tension is not a desirable trait.

Diving into UX and UI design

UX and UI: Two terms that are often used interchangeably, but actually mean very different things. So what exactly is the difference?

UX design refers to the term user experience design, while UI stands for user interface design. Both elements are crucial to a product and work closely together. But despite their relationship, the roles themselves are quite different.

Ensure that interactive elements are easy to identify

Good design guides the user by communicating purpose and priority. For that reason, every part of the design should be based on an "informed decision" rather than an arbitrary result of personal taste or the current trend.

Provide distinct styles for interactive elements, such as links and buttons, to make them easy to identify. For example, "change the appearance of links" on mouse hover, "keyboard focus", and "touch-screen activation".

Breaking down the barriers

Design is not the end-all solution to all of the worlds problems but with the right thinking and application, it can definitely be a good beginning to start tackling them.

item.title: All-time Top Food
item.dc:creator: sasha
item.content:encoded: We have over 180 total homemade recipes and up to 12 meals to choose from daily. Much of the food ingredients are sourced from nature.

item.title: Breakfast
item.dc:creator: sasha
item.content:encoded: Well-balanced breakfast can give you energy and prevent you from eating too much during the rest of the day. Here are the 12 best foods you can eat in the morning.

item.title: Dessert
item.dc:creator: sasha
item.content:encoded: Satisfy your sweet tooth with dessert recipes from Food Network, including cookies, cupcakes and pies.

item.title: Homemade Margherita Pizza
item.dc:creator: sasha
item.content:encoded: A classic homemade Margherita pizza with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: a:1:{i:0;a:3:{s:11:"ingredients";a:7:{i:0;a:7:{s:3:"uid";i:0;s:6:"amount";s:2:"1 ";s:4:"unit";s:6:"pound ";s:4:"name";s:11:"pizza dough";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:7:"unit_id";i:40;s:2:"id";i:41;}i:1;a:7:{s:3:"uid";i:1;s:6:"amount";s:3:"1/2";s:4:"unit";s:3:"cup";s:4:"name";s:11:"pizza sauce";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:7:"unit_id";i:42;s:2:"id";i:43;}i:2;a:7:{s:3:"uid";i:2;s:6:"amount";s:1:"8";s:4:"unit";s:6:"ounces";s:4:"name";s:24:"fresh mozzarella, sliced";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:7:"unit_id";i:44;s:2:"id";i:45;}i:3;a:6:{s:3:"uid";i:3;s:6:"amount";s:1:"2";s:4:"unit";s:0:"";s:4:"name";s:14:"large tomatoes";s:5:"notes";s:13:"thinly sliced";s:2:"id";i:46;}i:4;a:6:{s:3:"uid";i:4;s:6:"amount";s:1:"1";s:4:"unit";s:0:"";s:4:"name";s:18:"Fresh basil leaves";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:2:"id";i:47;}i:5;a:7:{s:3:"uid";i:5;s:6:"amount";s:1:"2";s:4:"unit";s:12:"tablespoons ";s:4:"name";s:9:"olive oil";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:7:"unit_id";i:48;s:2:"id";i:49;}i:6;a:6:{s:3:"uid";i:6;s:6:"amount";s:0:"";s:4:"unit";s:0:"";s:4:"name";s:24:"Salt and pepper to taste";s:5:"notes";s:0:"";s:2:"id";i:50;}}s:4:"name";s:0:"";s:3:"uid";i:-1;}}

a:1:{i:0;a:3:{s:12:"instructions";a:9:{i:0;a:5:{s:3:"uid";i:0;s:4:"name";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:43:"

Preheat your oven to 475F (245C)

";s:5:"image";i:0;s:11:"ingredients";a:0:{}}i:1;a:5:{s:3:"uid";i:1;s:4:"name";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:75:"

Roll out the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle on a floured surface.

";s:5:"image";i:370;s:11:"ingredients";a:0:{}}i:2;a:5:{s:3:"uid";i:2;s:4:"name";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:57:"

Transfer the dough to a pizza pan or baking sheet.

";s:5:"image";i:0;s:11:"ingredients";a:0:{}}i:3;a:5:{s:3:"uid";i:3;s:4:"name";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:52:"

Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough.

";s:5:"image";i:0;s:11:"ingredients";a:0:{}}i:4;a:5:{s:3:"uid";i:4;s:4:"name";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:65:"

Arrange the sliced tomatoes and mozzarella over the sauce.

";s:5:"image";i:0;s:11:"ingredients";a:0:{}}i:5;a:5:{s:3:"uid";i:5;s:4:"name";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:70:"

Season with salt and pepper, then drizzle with olive oil."

";s:5:"image";i:0;s:11:"ingredients";a:0:{}}i:6;a:5:{s:3:"uid";i:6;s:4:"name";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:113:"

Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly.

";s:5:"image";i:0;s:11:"ingredients";a:0:{}}i:7;a:5:{s:3:"uid";i:7;s:4:"name";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:68:"

Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before slicing.

";s:5:"image";i:0;s:11:"ingredients";a:0:{}}i:8;a:5:{s:3:"uid";i:8;s:4:"name";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:53:"

Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve hot.

";s:5:"image";i:0;s:11:"ingredients";a:0:{}}}s:4:"name";s:0:"";s:3:"uid";i:-1;}}
For extra flavor, you can sprinkle some grated Parmesan cheese over the pizza before baking.
